benchmark_details.name: PropInfer
benchmark_details.overview: PropInfer is a benchmark task for evaluating property inference in large language models (LLMs) under question-answering and chat-completion paradigms, focusing on the confidentiality of fine-tuning datasets.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate property inference attacks on LLMs and provide a standardized framework for future research and evaluation.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Specialized attacks may not apply to all LLMs and task configurations.

data.size: 29,791 conversations for gender labeling, 50,000 for medical diagnosis
data.annotation: Labeling using ChatGPT-4o and manual inspection

methodology.calculation: MAE calculated as the absolute error between predicted and actual property ratios.
methodology.interpretation: Lower MAE indicates better performance in inferring property ratios.
methodology.validation: Empirical evaluations across multiple pretrained LLMs.
